title: Preserves aquatic native species populations, biodiversity and aquatic recreational activities
summary: Preserves aquatic native species populations, biodiversity and aquatic recreational activities; defines terms; provides for enforcement.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          568

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. SAYWARD, GUNTHER, SCHROEDER, DUPREY, BURLING,
         FINCH, CASTRO, TOBACCO, WEISENBERG, JAFFEE,  McDONOUGH,  GALEF,  RAIA,
         JORDAN  --  Multi-Sponsored  by -- M.  of A. BARCLAY, CALHOUN, CROUCH,
         GLICK, KOLB, MOLINARO, THIELE, TITONE -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation  to  the
         preservation  of  aquatic native species populations, biodiversity and
         aquatic recreational activities

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 15 of the environmental conservation law is amended
    2  by adding a new title 35 to read as follows:
    3                                  TITLE 35
    4                          AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES
    5  SECTION 15-3501. LEGISLATIVE INTENT.
    6          15-3503. DEFINITIONS.
    7          15-3505. ILLEGAL ACTIONS.
    8          15-3507. PENALTY FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
    9          15-3509. ENFORCEMENT.
   10  S 15-3501. LEGISLATIVE INTENT.
   11    THIS  TITLE  IS  INTENDED  TO  PREVENT  THE INTRODUCTION AND SPREAD OF
   12  AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES INTO AND WITHIN THE WATERS OF THE STATE OF  NEW
   13  YORK, IN ORDER TO PRESERVE AQUATIC NATIVE SPECIES POPULATIONS, BIODIVER-
   14  SITY AND AQUATIC RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK.
   15  S 15-3503. DEFINITIONS.
   16    FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF  THIS TITLE, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL HAVE THE
   17  FOLLOWING MEANINGS:
   18    1. "AQUATIC ANIMALS" SHALL MEAN AN ANIMAL THAT SPENDS PART OF ITS LIFE
   19  IN WATER; INCLUDING, BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO,  FRESHWATER,  ESTUARINE  AND
   20  WETLAND SPECIES.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01296-01-1

       A. 568                              2

    1    2.  "AQUATIC  PLANTS"  SHALL MEAN PLANTS LIVING IN THE WATER OR AT THE
    2  SHORELINE, AND INCLUDES ROOTS, RHIZOMES, STEMS, LEAVES OR SEEDS; INCLUD-
    3  ING FRESHWATER, ESTUARINE AND WETLAND SPECIES.
    4    3.  "AQUATIC  RECREATION" SHALL MEAN ACTIVITIES ON, IN OR AROUND WATER
    5  BODIES INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO BOATING, FISHING, HUNTING AND SWIM-
    6  MING.
    7    4. "BIODIVERSITY" SHALL MEAN A MEASURE OF THE VARIETY  OF  PLANTS  AND
    8  ANIMALS,  THEIR  GENETIC  VARIABILITY,  AND THEIR INTERRELATIONSHIPS AND
    9  ECOLOGICAL PROCESSES WITHIN A GIVEN REGION, LANDSCAPE, OR WATERSHED.
   10    5. "INTRODUCE" SHALL MEAN TO RELEASE,  INCLUDING  INADVERTENTLY,  INTO
   11  THE NATURAL WORLD BY HUMAN SOURCES.
   12    6.  "INTRODUCTION"  SHALL  MEAN  THE  SPREAD OF AN INVASIVE SPECIES BY
   13  HUMAN SOURCES.
   14    7. (A) "INVASIVE SPECIES" SHALL MEAN AN AQUATIC SPECIES THAT IS:
   15    (I) NONNATIVE TO THE ECOSYSTEM UNDER CONSIDERATION; AND
   16    (II) WHOSE INTRODUCTION CAUSES OR IS LIKELY TO CAUSE ECONOMIC OR ENVI-
   17  RONMENTAL HARM OR HARM TO HUMAN HEALTH. IN THE  LATTER  CASE,  THE  HARM
   18  MUST SIGNIFICANTLY OUTWEIGH ANY BENEFITS.
   19    (B)  ACCORDING  TO THE DEPARTMENT, THE FOLLOWING IS AN ONGOING LIST OF
   20  EXAMPLES OF AQUATIC INVASIVE PLANTS AND ALGAE:
   21    (I) BRAZILIAN WATERWEED - EGERIA DENSA;
   22    (II) CURLY-LEAF PONDWEED - POTAMOGETON CRISPUS;
   23    (III) DIDYMO - DIDYMOSPHENIA GEMINATE;
   24    (IV) EURASIAN WATER MILFOIL - MYRIOPHYLLUM SPICATUM;
   25    (V) EUROPEAN FROG'S BIT - HYDROCHARIS MORSUS-RANAE;
   26    (VI) FANWORT - CABOMBA CAROLINIANA;
   27    (VII) STARRY STONEWORT - NITELLOPSIS OBTUSA;
   28    (VIII) WATER CHESTNUT - TRAPA NATANS;
   29    (IX) WATER PRIMROSE - LUDWIGIA PEPLOIDES; AND
   30    (X) PURPLE LOOSESTRIFE - LYTHRUM SALICARIA.
   31    (C) THE FOLLOWING ARE EXAMPLES OF AQUATIC INVASIVE ANIMALS:
   32    (I) ASIATIC CLAM - CORBICULA FLUMINEA;
   33    (II) FISHHOOK WATER FLEA - CERCOPAGIS PENGOI;
   34    (III) NORTHERN SNAKEHEAD - CHANNA ARGUS;
   35    (IV) QUAGGA MUSSEL - DREISSENA BUGENSIS;
   36    (V) ROUND GOBY - NEOGOBIS MELANOSTOMUS;
   37    (VI) RUSTY CRAYFISH - ORCONECTES RUSTICUS;
   38    (VII) SPINY WATERFLEA - BYTHOTREPHES CEDERSTOEMI;
   39    (VIII) TENCH - TINCA TINCA; AND
   40    (IX) ZEBRA MUSSELS - DREISSENA POLYMORPHA.
   41    8. "NATIVE/INDIGENOUS SPECIES" SHALL MEAN THOSE SPECIES THAT  ARRIVED,
   42  ESTABLISHED, AND SURVIVED IN A LOCATION WITHOUT DIRECT OR INDIRECT HUMAN
   43  ASSISTANCE.
   44    9.  "NONINDIGENOUS"  SHALL  MEAN  ORGANISMS  THAT HAVE BEEN MOVED FROM
   45  THEIR NATIVE ENVIRONMENTS OR ECOSYSTEMS TO A NEW LOCATION.
   46    10. "PERSON" SHALL MEAN A HUMAN INDIVIDUAL.
   47    11. "REMOVE" SHALL MEAN TAKING SOMETHING  AWAY;  MAKING  SOMETHING  GO
   48  AWAY.
   49    12.  "STANDING  WATER"  SHALL  MEAN BILGE WATER AND OTHER WATER INSIDE
   50  BOAT COMPARTMENTS THAT COULD EASILY BE REMOVED BY PUMP OR HAND.
   51    13. "WATER BODY" SHALL MEAN ANY FRESHWATER OR ESTUARINE  LAKE,  RIVER,
   52  POND,  STREAM  OR  WETLAND  EXISTING  IN  THE STATE, WHETHER PUBLICLY OR
   53  PRIVATELY OWNED, INCLUDING THE BANKS AND SHORES THEREOF.
   54  S 15-3505. ILLEGAL ACTIONS.
   55    TO PREVENT THE INTRODUCTION AND SPREAD  OF  AQUATIC  INVASIVE  SPECIES
   56  INTO AND WITHIN THE WATERS OF THE STATE:

       A. 568                              3

    1    1.  NO  PERSON SHALL ENTER OR EXIT A WATER BODY OF THE STATE UNLESS HE
    2  OR SHE REMOVES ALL AQUATIC PLANTS, ANIMALS AND STANDING WATER WHICH  ARE
    3  VISIBLE  TO  THE UNAIDED EYE FROM INSIDE AND OUTSIDE HIS OR HER VEHICLE,
    4  BOAT, PERSONAL WATERCRAFT, BOAT TRAILER  OR  OTHER  EQUIPMENT  THAT  HAD
    5  PREVIOUSLY COME IN CONTACT WITH ANY WATER BODY.
    6    2.  NO  PERSON  SHALL  TRAVEL OVERLAND WITHIN THE STATE WITH VEHICLES,
    7  BOATS, PERSONAL  WATERCRAFT,  BOAT  TRAILERS  OR  OTHER  EQUIPMENT  THAT
    8  CONTAIN  STANDING WATER, AQUATIC PLANTS AND/OR ANIMALS WHICH ARE VISIBLE
    9  TO THE UNAIDED EYE.
   10  S 15-3507. PENALTY FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
   11    1. ANY VIOLATION OF SECTION 15-3505  OF  THIS  TITLE  JEOPARDIZES  THE
   12  PURPOSE OF THIS TITLE, AND, THEREBY, THE WATER BODIES AND NATIVE SPECIES
   13  POPULATIONS OF THE STATE.
   14    2.  ANY PERSON WHO VIOLATES SECTION 15-3505 OF THIS TITLE IS GUILTY OF
   15  A CRIMINAL VIOLATION AND IS PUNISHABLE WITH A MAXIMUM TWO HUNDRED  FIFTY
   16  DOLLAR SURCHARGE AND UP TO FIFTEEN DAYS IN JAIL.
   17  S 15-3509. ENFORCEMENT.
   18    ALL VEHICLES AND BOATS ARE SUBJECT TO INSPECTION BY ANY NEW YORK PEACE
   19  OR  POLICE OFFICERS OR AUTHORIZED ENFORCEMENT AGENTS AS PER THE CRIMINAL
   20  PROCEDURE LAW.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   22  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   23  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal  of  any  rule  or  regulation
   24  necessary  for  the implementation of this act on its effective date are
   25  authorized and directed to be made  and  completed  on  or  before  such
   26  effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to the preservation of aquatic native species populations, biodiversity and aquatic recreational activities
